Any feedback on this would be appreciated.
Screenshot-from-2020-04-25-21-53-40.png
In https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/5591, there was a suggestion by Tim Abbott to hide the drafts UI if there are no drafts.

  1. Should I hide the drafts button shown in the image or should I hide the Drafts link while composing? I'll say we hide the link only.
  2. Should we hide anything in the first place?
I feel that hiding them would lead to newcomers not knowing about drafts and then the link awkwardly popping up if a draft is saved.

I just made a PR for this https://github.com/zulip/zulip/pull/14749.
I'm holding on the hiding part until I get some suggestions. I can always add it later(shouldn't be much work).

I don't have strong feelings on this. Generally an issue with ID <10000 that's not marked as a priority is something that hasn't been thought about in years.
Okay. The PR's always there if you change your mind.
